Value: The ground there is too steep...you can only set up a Battle Cannon on flat ground.
I've figured it out!  I've figured out how this whole thing happened.
Come down to the Temple...I'll show you.  And I know how to stop it once and for all.
This is it, the birthplace of the Darwinian civilisation.  Every Darwinian that has ever lived was originally born here.
This is going to be a tough battle, but hopefully a decisive one.  This is one of the last locations that is still heavily infected.  Good luck.
If we can capture this Biosphere, we'll have the Darwinian population back to its former numbers in no time.
The Darwinians are born from Spawn Points that are dotted all around the local islands.  Like all buildings in Darwinia, these Spawn Points need Darwinians to operate.
In order to prevent chronic overpopulation, there are limits to how many Darwinians can be Spawned on each island.
This is the Master Spawn Point, and it is responsible for controlling the global birth rate.  It controls and synchronises every other Spawn Point around it.
It takes the Unprocessed Spirits from the Receiver Location, and processes them using the code signal from the Pattern Buffer.
It then sends out those newly processed Spirits to the Spawn Points that need them.
Unfortunately, the Viral corruption to the Pattern has resulted in this whole location being filled with Evil Darwinians.
You'll have to build up your Green Darwinian Army and take them on directly for control of the Spawn Points.
It looks like we've pretty much wiped out the Red Army.
A large number of Darwinians are trapped here and need to be rescued.
They've no way to reach safety on their own, and right now we need every Darwinian we can get.
Open up the Radar Dish links and escort the Darwinians through them onto the main island.
You'll have to fight your way through some fairly heavy viral infection.
This is the ultimate target area.  Once the Darwinians reach here they'll be safe.  I want you to get at least 100 into this area.
The Engineers have finished reprogramming a building
I think that's plenty of Darwinians in the safe area now.
The incubator is running!  This is excellent.  The Engineers will pick up all the souls of the dead creatures nearby, and drop them into this building.
Those souls will then be converted back into Darwinians, one at a time.  This is how we will rebuild the Darwinian population.
Unfortunately, I designed the system so that the Darwinians have their own free will - which means we can't directly control them like you do with the Squad.
But there are ways we can influence them indirectly.  Carry on clearing up the infection and harvesting the spirits...I'll get back to you.
When the viral outbreak occurred, I had a lot of trouble getting it under control.
I had no choice but to shut down the Trunk Port gate system that connects each location in Darwinia.
This is the only place where I was able to hold my ground against the Virus.  The double shield of this location acts as a fantastic barrier.
I've highlighted the three disabled Trunk Ports on this island, and you'll need to open all of them.
Once opened, the Trunk Ports will give us access to a number of important locations for later.

Oh fantastic, you've found my code for the Officer program.  This handy little program will enable you to promote individual Darwinians to Officers, and use those Officers to order the other Darwinians around.
To create an Officer, bring up the Task Manager and click on the Officer icon.  Then click on a Darwinian you wish to Promote.
To create an Officer, bring up the Task Manager and select the Officer icon.  Then select a Darwinian you wish to Promote.
To create an Officer, draw this gesture then click on a Darwinian you wish to Promote.
To create an Officer, draw this gesture then select a Darwinian you wish to Promote.
The Darwinians that you've birthed so far aren't safe...I want you to move them under the tree inside the shielded area (highlighted), using the Officer program.
We need to start rebuilding the Darwinian population.  The Incubators are the key.
Clear the viral infection outside the shielded area, then use Engineers to collect the souls of the dead Virii and carry them to the Incubators.
There are three Incubators dotted around this location, and they will rebirth the collected enemy souls into Darwinians.
Promote some of the Darwinians to Officers, and use them to escort the remaining Darwinians safely back to the inside of the shielded area.
I want you to rescue at least 150 Darwinians in this manner, just to be on the safe side.  The Darwinians will be safe inside the shielded area, for now.
But really, this is the important bit.  These guys are the Darwinians.
I've spent the better part of the last decade nurturing these fellows, and I'm very proud of them indeed.
If the virus had its way, they'd all be dead already.  But I've managed to save a few of them.
There have been over ten-thousand generations of Darwinians, and the loss in AI research alone would be unthinkable.
They're an astonishing act of creation.  Each and every Darwinian has his own digital soul which occupies his body during life, and returns to the Central Repository after death.
You'll need to help me rebuild their numbers.  I'll help you out as you go.  For now, start clearing out the viral infection outside the shielded area.
Good work, looks like some of the Darwinians have reached the safe area.  But it's not enough.  If we're going to get Darwinia back online, we'll need quite a few more.

I think we should aim to get around 150 Darwinians into the safe area.  Clear out the infection on the neighbouring islands, harvest the souls, and escort the Darwinians safely back until you have enough.
I've been working on a design for a Weapons Platform that the Darwinians can use to fight the Virus.
There's still a lot of work to do, but we can manufacture these weapons within Darwinia.
Darwinia already has a solid engineering system for building things, but like everything else, it's offline.
The system is built over three locations - the Mine, the Generator, and the Yard.
Let me show you the Mines first.
So the Mines produce refined Primitives and send them to the Yard.
The Yard also requires Energy, which comes from the Generator.
So the Generator produces the Energy.
The Yard receives the Energy and the Primitives, and that's where we will be building the new weapons platform.
If you need help with these tasks, open the Objectives Screen...
...There you can click on an objective and I'll do my best to clarify it for you.
This is the Generator.  Here the Energy that drives Darwinia is produced and regulated.
The Solar Panels dotted around this location harness the energy radiated out by the Soul Repository at the center of Darwinia.
Like most buildings in Darwinia, these Solar Panels require Darwinians at their control pads in order to operate.
This building is Darwinia's Primary Power Generator.
It modulates the power from the Solar Panels into a Regulated Energy Stream that we can use.
That Energy Stream then passes through the Trunk Port to the Construction Yard.
Unfortunately this Trunk Port is broken, so we'll have to enable the link from the other end once we reach the Yard.
This entire location is one giant mining facility, unfortunately now overrun by this damn Virus.
Raw Polygons are ripped out of the hillside and dumped onto the passing mine carts.
Those Polygons then pass through this Refinery which converts them into Primitives.
I designed this world to be owned and operated entirely by the Darwinians.  All these buildings need Darwinians at their controls in order to function.
Entire generations of Darwinian miners have worked these quarries before the Virus arrived.
Once the Primitives have been refined, they need to be transported to the Construction Yard where we can make some use of them.
We hope you've enjoyed playing Darwinia!
To carry on playing please buy the game.
You cannot create a new location.\nYou must first create a MOD from the main menu\nbefore you can add locations.
Are you sure you want to stop your game and play the Prologue level?
will be lost and you will
You cannot save the location data.\nYou must first create a MOD from the main menu\nbefore you can edit and save locations.
Are you sure you wish to skip the Prologue and begin the main game?
Your controller has been disconnected. Please connect the controller to continue.
Darwinia: Vista Edition is only compatible with Windows Vista.\nPlease visit http://www.darwinia.co.uk for a compatible version of Darwinia.\nWould you like to visit http://www.darwinia.co.uk now?
Current Parental Control Settings will not allow Darwinia: Vista Edition to be played
Fantastic, that's the last of the Infected Spam Mail destroyed!
When you're ready, exit the location and we'll have a look around the revitalised world together.
Excellent work!  The Engineers will now busy themselves downloading that item of Research into my computer.
Unfortunately almost all of my research was lost a few hours ago when this virus outbreak occurred, so you may run into more research like this one later on.

It will be extremely helpful to me if you could use Engineers to download each research item when you find them.  I'm extremely busy right now trying to stop this damn Virus, and I don't have time to sort it out myself.
Who the hell are you?  How did you get in here?
I thought I'd terminated all external connections.
OK fine, if you're going to stay you can at least make yourself useful.
Take some time to get your bearings, then help me wipe out this Red Virus.
If you get stuck, press [KEYSEPULVEDAHELP] and I'll give you some tips.
Before we can sort this out, we need to get out of this location.  What I need you to do here is to open up this Trunk Port for me.
It's got a standard Control Tower nearby, so you can send in one of your Engineers to reprogram it and then we'll be able to use it.
You may have noticed those Virii leaving little red things behind when you killed them.  Those are digital DNA...digital souls, if you'll excuse the term.
Every living creature in Darwinia has its own digital soul.  Originally they were intended for the Darwinians, but the Virus has swallowed most of them up by now.
I'm sorry if I was rude to you on that island, I've had my hands full for the past few hours.

My name is Dr Sepulveda, and I'm the Creator of the Darwin Digital Life project.  I would normally welcome you to Darwinia and show you around, but I'm afraid things have gone a bit wrong today and we'll have to give the guided tour a miss.
I need you to help me open up some more of the infected locations.  The Containment location is sort of a hub world.  Please go to that location and I'll explain more when you've connected.
There are three groups of Solar Panels dotted around the landscape.  Like most of the buildings in this world, they require Darwinians manning them in order to operate.
Once they're online, they will harness the energy radiated out from the Soul Repository at the center of Darwinia.
That energy is then transferred through pylons to the primary Generator, where it is modulated into a form that can be used by buildings all around the world.
We'll need to achieve a power output of at least 65 Gigaquads per second in order to do anything substantial.
This trunk port would normally transfer the modulated energy to the Construction Yard.
Unfortunately there's no way to access it here, so we'll have to open it from the other end at the Construction Yard.
But we'll worry about that later.
This building is Darwinia's primary power Generator.  It supplies power to every location and every building in this world.
We're going to start building things we can use as weapons against the invasion, and for that we're going to need a lot more Energy.
W3rning  : ErroHrs det.c.d in data stre.m.
Connecting to Darwin Research Associates Project Server...
Welcome to the Internet's first Digital Theme Park.
Please try not to harm or scare the native Darwinians.
Warning : Errors detected in data stream.
On behalf of Dr Sepulveda and the team, we hope you enjoy your visit.
Warning : Errors detected in data stream.
between you and the full game.
You've found some of my Research into Darwinian weaponry!
This research item will equip our green Darwinians with the same grenades your Squaddies are using.
Our Darwinians will stand a much better chance against those evil Red Virii now that they have Grenades.
This island is heavily infected with the Virus.
Remember to capture the nearby Incubator with an Engineer, and harvest the souls of the dead as you kill them.
Don't be afraid to use the newly born Darwinians as fighters, by ordering them to attack the enemy with your Officers.
The three Fuel Pumps are now operating perfectly, and the Rocket is being refuelled.  Well done.
We now face the final hurdle.  We must attack and destroy the evil red Darwinians that occupy the launch pad.
Those buildings they are clustered around are called Spawn Points.  You'll need to take control of them from the Red Army.
You can think of these buildings as Incubators running on automatic - they will spawn new Darwinians endlessly, until a certain population is reached.
Currently they are controlled by the Red Darwinians, so the newly spawned Darwinians will also be Red.
Once you capture the first of these Spawn Points you will start receiving new Green Darwinians immediately.
In order to capture the first Spawn Point you will need to bring friendly Green Darwinians through this Radar Dish link.
The Red Darwinians will attack you as soon as you take the first Spawn Point from them, so be careful.
Greetings visitor, and welcome to Darwinia!
My God, they're trying to destroy the Rocket!
This is insane, they'll cause an explosion that will wipe out all the Darwinians inside!
I can't believe this is happening.
My name is Dr Sepulveda and I'm the creator of this digital world.
You've come at a great time.  The native Darwinians have been busy.
Since the end of the Great War they've taken it upon themselves to build a rocket.
The Darwinians are a totally digital lifeform, running inside a very large supercomputer.
Each generation is more ambitious than the last.  They all want to be the first into their new rocket.
I'm not sure what the Darwinians ultimately wish to achieve here.
But this is clearly their most ambitious project yet.
They've been growing and improving for thousands of generations and have their very own culture and beliefs.
This rocket is the culmination of all their dreams and ambitions, and it's taken them an incredibly long time to get this far.
But the Darwinians knew there was more.  They manipulated the rendering subsystem until they could see beyond their world.
Those star systems are other mainframes and servers on the Internet, all connected in a giant world wide web.
I realise now that their intention is to explore the millions of computer systems they can now see around them.
The Great Rocket project will be their finest achievement, and it will open their horizons to every computer system in the world.
And if it wasn't for this Virus, they'd already be out there.
I can still remember a time before the Virus came, before the great war that almost destroyed this world.
The Darwinians fought so hard, and came so far, and I really did think we'd cleared the system of the infection.
But it seems now that every time I turn my back, there's another outbreak somewhere and more Darwinians are killed.
The control the Darwinians now have over their world is amazing.
The Launchpad is one of many locations in Darwinia, but it's the first the Darwinians have built entirely on their own.
The renderer you're looking at didn't know what to do outside the confines of the world...it used to be just a blank space.
There are three Fuel Pumps on this map.
Their function is to extract raw minerals from the sea bed, and process it into liquid fuel the Rocket can use in its engines.
The Fuel Pumps are powered by Solar Panels nearby.
These Solar panels require Darwinians at their base in order to operate.
Clear out the Viral infection around the Solar panels, then escort some Darwinians to them using Officers.
Once operational the Solar Panels will power the Fuel Pump, which will in-turn push liquid fuel into the Rocket.
Our primary aim is to help the Darwinians launch their Rocket.
In order to do that we will first need to refuel it.
The fuel is generated by the 3 highlighted Fuel Pumps, which push the fuel direct into the Rocket's fuel tanks.
Bring those Fuel Pumps online by manning the solar panels around the map with Darwinians.
Once the Rocket is fully refuelled we will be able to attempt another launch.
To align this Radar Dish, first wait until it has been reprogrammed, then deselect your current task by pressing B.
You can then select the Radar Dish by pressing A, and align it by targetting the receiving Radar Dish and pressing A again.
When you are done, deselect the dish by pressing B.
Align this Radar dish to the center island.
You can then guide Darwinians through the link using an Officer.
I want to thank you, from the bottom of my heart.
If you want to see more of this world and learn about the Great War, please buy the full game now.
Come, I will show you how this all began, when Darwinia was changed forever...
To exit the Task Manager press TAB or click the screen
Research the Airstrike program (increases the number of bombers)
Research the Armour program (increases the carrying capacity, and the Cannon range)
Research the Darwinian program (equips them with better weapons)
Research the Engineer program (increases spirit carrying capacity)
Research the Grenade program (increases the range)
Research the Laser program (increases the range)
Research the Officer program (equips them with more order types)
Research the Rocket program (increases the range)
Research the Squad program (improves number of squaddies)
Research the Task Manager program (allows you to run more programs at once)
What I need you to do here is to open up this Trunk Port for me.
It's got a standard Control Tower nearby, so you can send in one of your Engineers to reprogram it.
Once it's reprogrammed, the location it is connected to will become available to us.
I can see some of my research up ahead.  I need you to retrieve it for me.
Create an Engineer nearby and he will download the Research into my computer system.  Hopefully it will be something that we can use against the Viral infection.
I'm afraid the Darwinians aren't clever enough to find their way along that route.  They need to see where they are going.
When I think of the number of stories and legends that must have been created since this outbreak occurred, well, it scares me.
I'm transferring permissions to the World Editor to your computer.  That's the tool I used to build every location you've seen so far.  You can access it from the Main Menu when you're up in Heaven.

I'm also transferring a new user profile to your system, which I've called AccessAllAreas.  You can load it from the Profiles menu.  It will give you full access to all the locations you've visited in Darwinia.
I'm afraid the Darwinians have a very long memory.  They still tell mournful stories of the island that was lost in the Server crash last year.
I don't know what effect this war will have on the Darwinians.  And I don't know what they'll want to do next.
But I do know that our actions here will live on through tale and folklore, for generations of Darwinians to come.
I don't think the Darwinians will ever truly forget what has happened.
In fact, I think this will turn out to be a defining moment in their history.
They're much more ambitious now, bolder and stronger and smarter than they ever were.  But their innocence has been lost.
The battle at the Biosphere is without doubt the darkest chapter yet in Darwinia's history.
The horrific loss of life in such a short period of time, and the very concept of Darwinians fighting and killing their own kin, makes it particularly potent for me.
It is my dream that Darwinia will continue to evolve and grow, long after I am gone.
I started the Darwin Digital Life project over a decade ago, and I've worked on it every single day in virtual isolation for all this time...
...only for my life's work to be saved today by a total stranger.
I want you to help me continue my work.  I'm transferring a profile to you that will give you access to every location in Darwinia.
It is clear to me now that I am no longer capable of running Darwinia on my own.  I want to give you the tools I used to build this world.
I want you to help me finish it.
Of all those who died, the Darwinians who fell under the Soul Destroyers will linger most in the survivors' memories.
Their Souls are irretrievably lost, with no possible hope of afterlife or rebirth awaiting them.
Their broken spirits will continue to haunt the places where they fell, until the end of the world.
Because of this, the Darwinians now understand, for the first time I think, what it truly means for one of their kind to die.
Unfortunately, the viral infection has spread to the Master Blueprint, and we need to clear it up.
There are four Pattern Loaders dotted around the location.  Each one must be occupied by Darwinians.
The Pattern Loaders are a safety step that I'm glad I thought of.  They will analyse and copy the Pattern in the Darwinians occupying the building.
That Pattern will then be beamed into the Master Blueprint by the hovering satellite dishes, overwriting the infection.
You'll need to occupy at least three of the Pattern Loaders to overwhelm the corruption in the Master Pattern.
Be careful, it looks like we've got some corrupted Darwinians transporting to the location, and they don't look friendly.
The Master Blueprint needs to be transmitted to the Biosphere through this Trunk Port.
That's strange, this Trunk Port has already been opened.
This entire location is one giant mining facility, unfortunately now overrun by this damn Virus.
There are four underground mines built into the side of the landscape.  Each one pulls raw Polygons from the mountainside.
Generations of Darwinian miners have worked these quarries and it's starting to show its toll on the hillside.
The Darwinians will extract the Polygons from deep inside the quarry and dump them into the mining carts as they move past, on their way to the Refinery.
We'll need to mine at least 20 Primitives to be able to build anything substantial.
Wonderful work, the Refinery is online and the motor system is running.  But the mine carts are still empty.  We need to bring the Mines themselves online to fill the carts.
There are four underground mines built into the side of the landscape.  Each one pulls raw Polygons from the mountainside.
This building at the center of the facility is the Refinery.  It converts mined Polygons into Primitives which can be used later to build things.
It also drives the motor system that moves the carts around the track.
This Refinery needs Darwinians at its control pads or else it's useless.  You'll need to safely escort some Darwinians up here to get the facility moving.
Once the Primitives have been refined, they need to be transported to the Construction Yard where they can be used to build things.
Bring this Trunk Port online so the refined Primitives can be transported away.
Those evil Darwinians that we saw at the Pattern Buffer definitely came from the Biosphere.
It looks like the Virus infected some of the birthing equipment, and the corrupted Pattern caused Red Darwinians to be born instead of Green.
This is an unexpected development.  It's going to make recapturing the Biosphere a lot harder.
It looks like you've failed at your mission.  Feel free to try again.
Good work, it looks like you've completed all the Primary Objectives.
Each of those collectors requires Darwinians at its base to operate, which means you'll have to clear out the viral infection first.
The grid then transports those Unprocessed Souls here.  This building brings together all the Unprocessed Souls from the grid and feeds them down a single line.
We will need to achieve a throughput of at least 50 Unprocessed Souls a minute to stand a chance of rebuilding the bulk of the Darwinian population.
Those Unprocessed Souls are then transported to the Biosphere, where they are processed and birthed into new Darwinians.
Once the Souls have been collected by the Spirit Receivers, they need to be transported to Darwinia's primary Biosphere.
There they will be processed and birthed into new Darwinians.  Open this Trunk Port to allow the Souls to be transmitted.
I'll try to improve the AirStrike for you.
Oh my goodness, this is excellent.  You've found my AirStrike program!  Select Airstrike as your Squad weapon by drawing the gesture, then throw the marker Grenade to show the program where to bomb.
I've improved the AirStrike program.  Each marker Grenade will now summon two Invaders to drop their bombs.
I've added another Invader to each AirStrike unit.
There will now be four Invaders for every AirStrike marker.  I've done all I can here.
I'll do some more work on the Armour program.  I think I can improve the capacity of the Armour, and maybe the range of the Battle Cannon.
I've upgraded the Armour program.  You can now fit 20 Darwinians inside.  I've also increased the range of the Battle Cannon.
The Armour program has been upgraded again.  You can now fit 30 Darwinians inside.  And I've increased the range of the Battle Cannon to more than twice its original spec.
I've increased the capacity of the Armour program to 40 Darwinians.  And the Battle Cannon is now at its maximum range.  I've done all I can here.
I'll try to improve the basic Darwinian code template.  Hopefully I should be able to give them some decent weapons to defend themselves.
I've upgraded the Darwinians so they can use Lasers!  This should help them defend against the Viral attack.
I've given the Darwinians Grenades.  It's a bit scary, but they should have a chance against stronger foes now.  I've done all I can here.
I'll work on improving the Engineers.  I think I can increase the number of spirits they can carry.
I've increased the number of spirits your Engineers can carry to 15.
I've increased the number of spirits your Engineers can carry to 25.
I've increased the spirit capacity of your Engineers to 30.  I've finished work on the Engineers now.
I'm going to keep working on the programs you are using for a while...the Squads, Engineers etc.
Most of them are still in very early stages of beta testing and I think I can improve all of them quite a bit with some work.
To see how I'm getting along, open the Task Manager, then scroll up.
From there you can set priorities for me...and I'll try to work on improving what you think is most important.
I'll work on the Grenade program.  I should be able to increase the weapon range.
You've found my research into the Grenade weapon!  This is fantastic.  While you are firing lasers with your squad, tap the Left Mouse Button to throw a Grenade.
I've increased the throw range of the Grenade program.
I've made another increase to the Grenade throw range.
That's it, I'm done with the grenades now.  The throw range has been pushed up as far as it will go.
I will try to improve the Laser program for you.  Hopefully I can get the range up a bit.
I've made some improvements to the Lasers.  They should have a longer range now.
I've improved the range of the Laser weapon again.
These lasers are amazing now.  They're nearly 3 times longer ranged than the originals.  I'm pretty much done with this program now.
I don't think I can make any more improvements to this Program.  I think you should pick something else for me to work on.
I haven't finished researching that program yet, you'll have to wait before you can use it.
I will get to work improving the Officer program.  I should be able to give him some useful Orders which we can use to influence the Darwinians.
I've upgraded the Officer program so they can now issue a FOLLOW order as well as the existing GOTO order.  Click and hold near an officer to toggle his orders.

I've given the Officers a new order called ABSORB.  This will absorb all nearby friendly Darwinians into a protective shield, which will keep the Officer safe in dangerous areas.  Click and hold near an officer to toggle his orders.
I'll get to work on the Rockets.  Hopefully I can increase their maximum range a bit.
Excellent, you've recovered the Rocket program.  You can select this Weapon with the Rocket gesture.  While you are firing lasers with your squad, tap the Left Mouse Button to launch a Rocket.
The Rocket range has been increased.
I've managed to increase the Rocket range again.
The rocket range is at its maximum now.
I'll work on improving the Squad program.  I should be able to increase the number of squad members in a single squad.
I've upgraded the Squad program that you are using.  You can now have 4 members in a squad.
I've made some more progress on the Squad program...you'll now get 5 members to a squad.
I've done as much as I can on the Squad program now.  You can now have 6 members.  I don't think I can get anymore out of this codebase.
I'll work on upgrading the Task Manager for you. It should be possible to run more programs simultaneously, with some tweaking.
I've made some changes to the Task Manager.  You can now run up to four programs simultaneously.
I've upgraded the Task Manager.  Now you can run five programs at once.  This is already pushing the system to its limits, so I don't think I can improve it anymore.
The Darwinian's saw a picture of me once.  They didn't stop celebrating for days.  For just a few seconds, my ridiculous face was projected onto the sky all over Darwinia.
I was working on the code for rendering the sky, and the texture data was accidentally overwritten with a live image from my Webcam, similar to what you see on your screen when I'm talking to you.
Ever since that day, the Darwinians have been hijacking the Construction Yard when I'm not looking and using it to build these rock faces, which they then transport all over the world.
It made me realise what an enormous responsibility I have as their Creator.
Long ago, the Darwinians began work on a temple.  It was their dream, I think, to somehow begin communicating with me.
Fearing what would happen next, I shut down the Link.  But it was too late.
Amongst the emails were a couple of Spam Mails, infected with a particularly nasty strain of Internet Virus.
I couldn't quite believe it was happening.
The Virus warped the Darwinians into the destructive creatures we've been fighting all this time.
Then they turned on the survivors.
They replicated themselves at such a terrifying rate.  They'd taken over most of the system before I could contain them.
In all honesty I had my finger on the Global Reset button.  I really did think my life's work had been ruined.
It was just at that moment when you arrived.  And thank God you arrived when you did!
It never occurred to me that one day they might actually succeed.
It's really quite ingenious.  They found a way to align one of the Trunk Ports with what they believed was Heaven...the Soul Repository at the center of Darwinia.
Thinking they were talking to God, they'd managed to open up a data stream and began downloading files from my computer.
My Research Programs were the first files to move through the link.
My attention was elsewhere.  I should have been watching them more closely.
They had the schematics and designs for how Darwinia was built.  They weren't ready for this information.
For the first time ever, they began to understand the nature of their simulated digital existence.
Next they downloaded all of my emails.  This was when I noticed something was wrong.
Three of the infected spam emails still exist, and they are all still active.
Anything that goes near them will be corrupted and converted into the Virus.
The good news is that we've cornered the Virus at this location.  These infected emails are the last source of the Virus that need to be destroyed.
You'll need to fight your way up to them and destroy them with explosives at close range.  Go for it!
OK I've finished the blueprints for the Weapons Platform and uploaded them into the system.
When you're ready, come down to the Yard level.  We'll need to bring it online and begin production immediately.
I've added the Armour program to your gesture list.  You can now summon Armour to any location by drawing this gesture.
I've added the Armour program to your list.  You can now summon Armour to any location from the Task Manager by clicking on the Armour icon.
The Armour will have to travel through the Trunk Port system, so you'll only be able to summon Armour near a local Trunk Port that you control.
If you remember, we couldn't open the Trunk Port connection from the Generator.
You'll need to open the connection from this end to allow the Regulated Energy Stream to pass through.
This is the Construction Yard.  From here I was able to boot-strap the production of virtually every building in Darwinia.
The Darwinians sometimes use the Yard to build things of their own when they think I'm not looking.  I would show you if I had the time.
But that will all have to wait.
This Construction Yard drives the mine carts.  The refined Primitives from the Mine will come through once the carts are moving.
The Yard will take the refined Primitives and the Regulated Energy Stream, and will start producing our weapons platforms, which I've called Armour.
What I've designed is sort of an armoured troop carrier that can be converted into a Battle Cannon, that either you or the Darwinians can operate.
Once we have these new weapons, we'll stand a very good chance against the core infection.  Good luck.

We now need to clear out the Ant Infestation that's currently clogging up the valley.

Once the Yard is online and producing Armour, wipe out the Ant infestation around this area and open up the Trunk Ports.
This is a jumping off point to the heavily infected areas of Darwinia, so it needs to be completely cleared.
It's an unfortunate fact that the areas of Darwinia that used to be heavily populated are now the most heavily infected.
These Souls need processing before they can re-enter the world as Darwinians.  Part of this Reprocessing occurs at the Pattern Buffer.
The Pattern Buffer contains the Master Blueprint for a Darwinian.
This chunk of data is the raw digital Pattern that prepares an Unprocessed Soul to be birthed into the world.
The Pattern is able to change as time passes, and represents the combined knowledge and abilities of every Darwinian that has ever lived.
So the Receiver collects up the Unprocessed Souls that fall from the Repository.
The Pattern Buffer stores the Master Blueprint for preparing an Unprocessed Soul.
The Pattern and the Unprocessed Souls are sent through the Trunk Port system to the Biosphere, where they are birthed into Darwinians.
Your task now is to re-enable these systems, and rebuild the Darwinian population.  Good luck.
Those are the areas we must now visit.
We need to make a concerted effort to rebuild the Darwinian population to its former strength, and wipe out the Viral Infection once and for all.
The Soul Repository at the center of Darwinia is the key to the Evolution and Rebirth system for the Darwinians.
The Souls of all the dead creatures eventually rise up and merge into the Repository, adding their experiences and wisdom to the group.
The Souls are slowly ordered based on how successful they were in life, and are sent back down to the Receiver location, to be eventually reborn into new Darwinians.
Here at the Receiver location, those Souls that were most successful in their previous lives slowly float down to the surface for another chance.
The buildings you see dotted around the landscape are designed to collect up the falling Souls and send them to the Biosphere.
For the Darwinians, this is the most sacred and holy site in all of the world.
It is something of a ritual for Darwinians to journey here on a pilgrimage early in the lives, to help with the rebirthing process.
Through this method, each generation of Darwinian comes of age by helping the next generation into the world.
When a Soul has spent a certain amount of time in the central Repository, it loses a great deal of its former structure.
In essence, a Soul forgets what it was like to exist on the surface.
